com.wpruszak.blitzch.controller

Class IOController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wpruszak.blitzch.controller.IOController

  • public class IOController
extends Object
    Input / Output controller implementation. Merges all of the on file operations in one class.

    The controller itself consist of two main interfaces implementations FileLoader and FileSaver.

    The basic implementation of these interfaces are : FileLoaderImpl and FileSaverImpl.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    setzo
    See Also:
    FileLoader, FileSaver, FileLoaderImpl, FileSaverImpl

      • loadDirectory

        public List<FileBean> loadDirectory(File[] files,
                                    List<FileBean> fileBeanList)
                             throws IOException
        Recursive load all files of a directory into List of FileBean objects, that will contain all of the files data.
        Parameters:
        files - to load data from into FileBean beans
        fileBeanList - list of FileBean objects containing information about our files, this parameter can and should be initially null, cause the list is created after first iteration of the method anyway.
        Returns:
        List of FileBean objects
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O is corrupted

      • loadFileBeanAsDirectory

        public FileBean loadFileBeanAsDirectory(File file)
        Loads File directory object into FileBean object.

        File object given as a parameter to this method must be a directory.

        Parameters:
        file - that is directory to load as FileBean object
        Returns:
        FileBean representation of the file given

      • saveStringToFileAppend

        public void saveStringToFileAppend(File file,
                                   String newContent)
                            throws IOException
        Save given String into given File appending it to the end of the file.

        This method will not erase the previous file contents. It will add given string at the end of the file.

        Parameters:
        file - to append given string to
        newContent - string to append to given file
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O is corrupted

      • saveStringToFileOverwrite

        public void saveStringToFileOverwrite(File file,
                                      String newContent)
                               throws IOException
        Save given String into given File overwritting the file and leaving the string as the only file content.

        This method will erase the previous file contents.

        Parameters:
        file - to overwrite with given string
        newContent - string to be overwritten as a new file
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O is corrupted
